Marvel is beginning to kick the motors for Avengers: Endgame into over drive, and the advancement machine is taking off.

By and by, Marvel Studios will join forces with numerous prevalent brands so as to bring issues to light for the following real Avengershybrid, similar to anybody on the planet has not yet known about it. This time, Coca-Cola will assume a noteworthy job, offering seven…

summary: Marvel releases a trailer for Endgame on April 1st, the internet goes wild. New theories are made, comments are made, everyone...
body: Marvel releases a trailer for Endgame on April 1st, the internet goes wild. New theories are made, comments are made, everyone is losing their shit. And then a month later after watching Endgame, everyone realizes that every single scene in that “trailer” was fake and Marvel just pulled the biggest April Fool’s prank ever.

reblog.comment: Marvel releases a trailer for Endgame on April 1st, the internet goes wild. New theories are made, comments are made, everyone is losing their shit. And then a month later after watching Endgame, everyone realizes that every single scene in that “trailer” was fake and Marvel just pulled the biggest April Fool’s prank ever.

trail.content_raw: Marvel releases a trailer for Endgame on April 1st, the internet goes wild. New theories are made, comments are made, everyone is losing their shit. And then a month later after watching Endgame, everyone realizes that every single scene in that “trailer” was fake and Marvel just pulled the biggest April Fool’s prank ever.
trail.content: Marvel releases a trailer for Endgame on April 1st, the internet goes wild. New theories are made, comments are made, everyone is losing their shit. And then a month later after watching Endgame, everyone realizes that every single scene in that “trailer” was fake and Marvel just pulled the biggest April Fool’s prank ever.

summary: Man after watching Captain Marvel I had a moment of sheer hype and hope for Avengers: Endgame, for Thanos to be completely...
body: Man after watching Captain Marvel I had a moment of sheer hype and hope for Avengers: Endgame, for Thanos to be completely ideologically destroyed before he gets punted into a black hole; then I remembered it’s directed by the Russo brothers, and I could write a whole essay about what I think of their movies but TL;DR they’re too white male intellectual for them to ever write the Avengers: Endgame that I want to see most. Still hype for it though.

reblog.comment: Man after watching Captain Marvel I had a moment of sheer hype and hope for Avengers: Endgame, for Thanos to be completely ideologically destroyed before he gets punted into a black hole; then I remembered it’s directed by the Russo brothers, and I could write a whole essay about what I think of their movies but TL;DR they’re too white male intellectual for them to ever write the Avengers: Endgame that I want to see most. Still hype for it though.

Still hype for it though.

Still hype for it though.

summary: Seriously, just give me a scene in Endgame where there’s a group of Avengers staring down this massive army with that kind of...
body:
Seriously, just give me a scene in Endgame where there’s a group of Avengers staring down this massive army with that kind of grim “impossible odds but we’ll fight to the bitter end” mentality…

And then Thor, Wanda and Carol just walk over and are like “you guys go rest. Keep planning how to destroy the gauntlet. We got this.” And then those three just proceed to wipe out the entire army by themselves, so casually that they’re having a conversation about something unrelated (”do you prefer flerkens or bilgesnipe?”) while they’re doing it and it takes like 3 minutes. Then they stroll back over to the other Avengers, not even out of breath.

Then they stroll back over to the other Avengers, not even out of breath.

And then Thor, Wanda and Carol just walk over and are like “you guys go rest. Keep planning how to destroy the gauntlet. We got this.” And then those three just proceed to wipe out the entire army by themselves, so casually that they’re having a conversation about something unrelated (”do you prefer flerkens or bilgesnipe?”) while they’re doing it and it takes like 3 minutes. And then Thor, Wanda and Carol just walk over and are like “you guys go rest. Keep planning how to destroy the gauntlet. We got this.” And then those three just proceed to wipe out the entire army by themselves, so casually that they’re having a conversation about something unrelated (”do you prefer flerkens or bilgesnipe?”) while they’re doing it and it takes like 3 minutes. Then they stroll back over to the other Avengers, not even out of breath.

title: Evil Movie Review: Captain Marvel
body:
Evil Movie Review: Captain Marvel

Hello Evil Geeks! It’s your friendly neighborhood Undiesofwondy here with a new review. It’s been a while, but sometimes, movies are so amazing that they practically compel you to write something about them. (Occasionally, they’re so terrible that they compel a review too, but this is definitely not the case for this movie.)
